page.title: 15Mr Musson,Blacksmith/Eng'eer
page.content: Mr Musson brought a portable forge to school and demonstrated the skills of the blacksmith. The most important tools were his hammer and anvil. He showed us how to make a poker which has a special hook on the end to remove the clinker from the fire. He uses special tar-free coal, mined in Yorkshire. It heats evenly over a wider area than household coal. Mr Musson runs a small engineering firm in Shirley, Southampton. His family have always been blacksmiths but after the last war had the foresight to adapt to this type of business rather than change to a garage as did other blacksmiths. Mr Mussons firm has just completed an order for specialist parts to help build new radio masts in the Falkland Islands.
